result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alyssa D Oberheu

defendant.name: Oberheu, Alyssa D
defendant.address: 5417 W National Ave, West Milwaukee, WI 53214

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Herring advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Memo e-Filed to defense counsel Herring 10/23/17, requesting he e-File a letter to the Court advising of defendant's current address.

ADDRESS INFO for Alyssa D Oberheu
Current: 5417 W National Ave, West Milwaukee, WI 53214 United States  (Effective: 10-23-2017)
Prior: 8885 S. 68th Street, c/o Milwaukee House of Corrections, Franklin, WI 53132 United States
Defendant Alyssa D Oberheu in court with attorney David L Herring.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dismissed and read in to Case #15CT727.
Hearing on October 3, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Alyssa D Oberheu in court by telephone from Milwaukee House of Corrections, in custody, with attorney David L Herring.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Herring requests a plea/sentencing hearing. Court believes an amended document will need to be filed. Defendant does have Huber privileges and will appear in person at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Faxed request to Milwaukee House of Corrections, re: defendant to appear by phone for Hearing on 8/30/17 at 2:00pm; copy of Notice of Hearing attached.
Hearing on August 30, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Alyssa D Oberheu in court, in custody and by telephone conference from MHOC, with attorney David L Herring.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Herring makes statements as to the status and indicates the defendant will be in custody until October.  Defendant to appear by phone at the next appearance.  Hearing scheduled for August 30, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Faxed request to Milwaukee House of Corrections, re: defendant to appear by phone for Hearing on 7/21/17 at 10:00am; copy of Notice of Hearing attached. Spoke with MHOC 7/3/17 and confirmed telephone appearance, Court to call (414) 427-4720
Hearing on July 21, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant Alyssa D Oberheu in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Alyssa D Oberheu in court, in custody, with attorney Katie Kegel as a friend of the Court .    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kegel indicates that their office will be appointing counsel for her.  Attorney Kegel requests that the $100.00 cash bond be converted to a $100.00 signature bond.  Defendant to appear by phone at next hearing.  Defendant is currently serving a sentence at the House of Corrections until October.  Court sets $1,000.00 signature bond on each of her cases.  Conditions will be the same as on the previous cash bond.  Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2017 at 10:00 am.  Check Case scheduled for July 3, 2017.
Hearing on June 29, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Alyssa D Oberheu in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Clerk of courts office to contact the public defender's office to have the defendant interviewed.  Defendant to remain at the Waukesha County Jail until the next hearing date.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 26, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Letter dated 5/5/17 from defendant, advising she is serving time at Milwaukee House of Corrections, and requesting time served.
